item.title: 'Transient' Issues
item.description: Doctors today have access to dozens of tools for diagnosing a panoply of medical issues. We have blood tests that can detect hundreds of different conditions and diseases, imaging that can see into different parts of your organs, and we can even detect if you have COVID from shit water (risky click!). Despite all the tools that doctors have available, there is still a set of conditions that are reached through what’s known as a “Diagnosis of Exclusion.

item.title: On proof of work
item.description: When I first heard about Bitcoin, proof of work (PoW) sounded like the coolest and most mysterious concept tied to the protocol. Mainstream media articles trying to describe the PoW process always fell short of a proper explanation for me. They usually read something like: “miners race to solve complex mathematical problems in order to validate the next block of transactions and earn bitcoins as a reward”, which sounded cool and all but only added to the mystery and the confusion.

item.title: I Built a Ruby Compiler
item.description: Note: Please don’t share this on Hacker News – I don’t need the grief from gatekeepers telling me I don’t know how to write a compiler. This is an account for myself and for friends. /hugs I said in my previous post, I Built a Ruby Parser, that I would write about my ongoing compiler project Natalie, but I really wanted to finish the compiler rewrite first. I’m proud to say the rewrite is finished!
